paper_abstract: We prove a conjecture of Ambrus, Ball and Erdelyi that equally spaced points maximize the minimum of discrete potentials on the unit circle whenever the potential is of the form (n)Sigma(k=1) f (d(z, z(k))), where f : [0, pi] -> [0, infinity] is non-increasing and convex and d(z, w) denotes the geodesic distance between z and w on the circle.
paper_title: Polarization Optimality of Equally Spaced Points on the Circle for Discrete Potentials
